sub_title: Supply Chain Optimization | Access to Medicines | Final Mile Delivery
summary:
End to End Supply Chain professional with over 15 years experience in the pharmaceuticals sector, with a Bachelor of Science (BSc) in Logistics (Hons) from Aston University.
Skilled in Supply Chain Optimization, Demand Planning, NPI, MA&D, Transport Management and Change Management.

After graduation, I became full time and took ownership of different sections, with responsibility for buying and merchandising. I then moved to manage the games section, making decisions on purchase quantities of the new releases, and procuring bargain accessories which appealed to the customers. 
I also worked in the stock room, improving the customer order process to reduce the time between order and collection. I was also involved in stock counts and mystery shopper satisfaction.", 'title': 'Sales and Games Buyer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 370106, 'name': 'World Duty Free Group', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHIDbkGRgcH6g/company-logo_400_400/0/1519873698036?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=OIKyUSscUkH5HU68cyeQdrhkE6_hAcOzbzRUZeRjKKI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-duty-free-group/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Runnymede CDC, Surrey, United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}}, 'company': 'World Duty Free - WDF', 'description': "My industrial placement for the 'sandwich' degree. As Logistics Project Manager, I managed various projects. Some were requested by management, and others were proposed after my 2 week Gemba of the operation and taking a voice of the customer survey.
The biggest improvement project was to implement a pack size operation, both for purchasing and supply. Once the data was available from suppliers, purchase orders were made in multiples of the pack sizes, which saved a lot of time in the receipt and storage process, especially with cosmetics, eliminating the single box of mixed colours and shades which needed to be split and validated.", 'title': 'Logistics Project Manager (Undergraduate Industrial Palcement)', 'employment_type': None}]}]
volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'role': 'Supply Chain Associate', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Clinton Health Access Initiative, Inc.', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHIDlSPs-QKRg/company-logo_400_400/0/1657636609645?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=MdGOehqBEbuHu30EuAvUxm0br4HcYnSLg3Yq6AYei1M', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/clinton-health-access-initiative/'}, 'cause': 'HEALTH', 'description': 'Volunteer on GSKs skills-based volunteering initiative, working on supply chain improvements for the Rwandan government drug stores (RBC/MPPD). Optimized the warehouse network, integrated a new warehouse into the existing set-up, arranged the facilities into zones, improving the efficiency, and allowing a rented warehouse to be released, creating sizeable cost savings.
Created an ABC analysis on pick frequency, rearranging the warehouse layout to facilitate a more efficient operation, reducing time to pick whilst also mitigating HSE risks.
Created an ABC analysis on value, to allow the quantification and planning team to focus on products using Pareto principles, turning the operation from loss making to sustainable.
Mapped the order placement process, highlighting to the team the need to communicate and work together, identifying areas of waste to be removed, reducing total lead times and implemented a stock management tool, utilizing Excel for a graphic projection of inventory. 
Coached some of the tools from the lean six sigma tool box, such as 5S and process mapping, and embedded supply chain capability into the local team, to make my changes sustainable. '}]
